techmeme.title: Deezer says ~18% of songs uploaded to the service are AI-generated; 20K AI-generated songs are uploaded daily, nearly twice the number reported four months ago (Reuters)
Q&A with Phil Spencer on A Minecraft Movie, potential IP for future movies, Microsoft's Hollywood goals, Fallout Season 2 and the Minecraft TV series, and more (Jennifer Maas/Variety)
Mark Zuckerberg says TikTok has been "probably the highest competitive threat for Instagram and Facebook over the last few years", in his third day of testimony (New York Times)
UBS: Nvidia's $5.5B inventory charge indicates ~$13B in actual H20 sales; Nvidia reported $17.11B in FY 2025 revenue from China, up from $10.31B in FY 2024 (Dan Gallagher/Wall Street Journal)
Spotify is down in the US, Europe, and more; users reported issues from 8:00AM ET, and Spotify says it is "aware of the outage" and it is not "a security hack" (Jess Weatherbed/The Verge)
